definition: to turn over in one's mind (idiom); to think through from different angles/to ponder
left/the Left (politics)/east/unorthodox/queer/wrong/differing/opposite/variant of 佐[zuo3]
surname Zuo
to think/to consider
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

sentences.english: He thought and thought until he came up with a good business plan.
sentences.chinese: 他左思右想，終於想出一個絕妙的生意點子。

sentences.english: Would you think twice about where your money was going?
sentences.chinese: 你會左思右想錢都用到哪去了嗎？

sentences.english: QinQiong think over and over, still cannot pass patricide enemy.
sentences.chinese: 秦瓊左思右想，始終無法放過殺父仇人。

sentences.english: You don't get upset and would not even give it a second thought.
sentences.chinese: 你不會心煩，甚至都不會對它左思右想。

sentences.english: She lay awake all night, thinking the matter over and over again.
sentences.chinese: 她躺在牀上左思右想，一夜也沒閤眼。

definition: to consider past cause and future effect (idiom); to think over the past and future/to ponder over reasons and connection
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to consider from all angles (idiom); to think hard/to rack one's brains
to think hard/bitter thoughts/to pour out one's sufferings
to ponder/to reckon/to turn sth over in one's mind
to reckon/to consider/to turn over in one's mind
to consider/to ponder
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
to hesitate
see 百思不解[bai3 si1 bu4 jie3]
pinyin: bai3 si1 bu4 de2 qi2 jie3

definition: to think sth through/to consider carefully
a bright idea suddenly occurs (idiom); to hit upon an inspiration/to be struck by a brainwave
to figure out/to work out (a solution etc)/to think up/to come up with (an idea etc)
over and over again/again and again
to consider/to turn over in one's mind
to fail to grasp the main points
